thread.title: Denver police motorcycle officer involved in downtown crash; injuries appear non-life threatening
thread.title_full: Denver police motorcycle officer involved in downtown crash; injuries appear non-life threatening

author: Jesse Paul
title: Denver police motorcycle officer involved in downtown crash; injuries appear non-life threatening
text:
A Denver Police Department motorcycle officer has been involved in a crash with a vehicle downtown on Friday afternoon on Speer Boulevard near the Pepsi Center.
Authorities say the officer’s injuries appear to be non-life threatening. The officer was taken to a hospital.
#TRAFFIC : #DPD responding to officer-involved motorcycle vs vehicle crash at Speer & Chopper Cir. Injuries unknown. Watch here for updates. pic.twitter.com/CUmi2ZKZX8 
— Denver Police Dept. (@DenverPolice) March 10, 2017 

The incident happened at the intersection of Speer Boulevard and Chopper Circle about 2:30 p.m. Police closed roads in the area, and several units responded to the scene.
Denver Crime See our map, report and neighborhood rankings of hit-and-runs in Denver .
Also, see our Denver crime map .
Further details on the situation were not immediately released.
Speer has been closed from the Pepsi Center to 8th Avenue near Denver Health medical center. Motorists should expect delays in the area.
This is a developing story that will be updated as more information becomes available. 

John Leyba, The Denver Post Police gather near the scene of a crash involving a Denver Police Department motorcycle on Speer Boulevard near the Pepsi Center on March 10, 2017.
